author: Staff Reporter
text:
Relatives block road in Kovilpatti

Tension prevailed in Kovilpatti on Tuesday evening when the relatives of M. Natarajan (60) of South Thittangulam, a retired TNSTC driver, who allegedly committed suicide after consuming poison on Monday evening, and members of Labour Progressive Front, the transport employees’ union of the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam, blocked road near Kovilpatti Government Headquarters Hospital refusing to accept the body.

A suicide note found at Natarajan’s house stated that he got dejected since his retirement benefits had not been settled even after one and a half years.

He got retired from service on April 30, 2014. He was expecting the retirement benefits since he was in debt, Kovilpatti Tahsildar K. Rajkumar Thangaseelan said, referring to the suicide note.

TNSTC officials, along with the Tahsildar and other officials, convinced the agitators saying that efforts would be made to ensure disbursement of his retirement benefits to his family in a month.

Later, the agitators received the body.

Kovilpatti East police have filed a case under Section 174 of the Code of Criminal Procedure. Further investigation is on.
title: Retirement benefits delayed: bus driver ends life
